title.narrative: Stöd till Center for Civil Liberties 2021-2024
Support to Center for Civil Liberties 2021 - 2024

description.narrative:
The intervention aims at supporting implementation of organizations strategy, which, among other things envisages contributing to and influencing public opinion and state policies, fosters civic activism, pursues participation in domestic and international networks and solidarity acts for human rights promotion and protection.
A good example is the newly assumed role of Secretariat for the Civil Solidarity Platform which will require additional expert, manly and otherwise related enhanced organizational capacities to perform the task. Civil Solidarity Platform brings together non-governmental organizations committed to improving the human rights situation in Europe, Eurasia and North America. Its aim is to serve as a conduit through which civic activists can build alliances, strengthen mutual support and solidarity, and improve their influence on national and international human rights policy.
Additionally, the organization commits to enhance institutional resiliency via implementing the recommendations of the Verification Audit, conducted by the independent consultancy firm NCG (Nordic Consulting Group) as part of the preparatory work to align the CSO with Sida programme support requirements and eligibility criteria.
Implementation of these recommendations will significantly strengthen the institutional capacity of the Center for Civil Liberties and will help to achieve the mission and goals of the organization more effectively.
Hence, it is assumed that accomplishing project specific objectives by implementing recommendations of system-based/verification audits and solving urgent problems of operational capacity with a long-term effect, the CSO will boost the potential of the Center for Civil Liberties to advance in its strategic priorities through enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.
